question: Will Allah forgive one who apostatizes from and blasphemes Islam, and then repents? What must happen for such a person to rejoin the ummah?
answer:
QUESTION
About a year ago I, being young and arrogant, declared myself an atheist. I became involved with a group of atheists online, and I shamelessly blasphemed Allah (swt), Islam, the holy Qur'an, Muhammad (saw), and his companions (ra) in the most disgusting and perverse manner. I did everything I could think of to ridicule Islam in their and my own eyes. I wish only to forget the abominable things I wrote. I can blame nobody but myself for it. Nobody led me astray. It was I who sought out evil books and ideas and unbelieving friends, and I who decided to pursue them to my ruin. Yes, blasphemy against all religions is extremely widespread in this country (the United States), but I have no excuse. I know that such things render one a riddah and a kafir, which deserve death. I know I deserve nothing better than hellfire, and in fact I am terrified at the prospect, yet I pray earnestly that Allah will forgive me my apostasy. I do not deserve to be called a Muslim sister; I do not deserve to be greeted with "Asalaamu alaikum." I am too ashamed to go to the masjid, even though nobody else knows of my deeds. I say Shahada with my whole heart every day, and I pray and fast, but I do not know if Allah (swt) will accept these things from me. What shall I do to repent?
ANSWER
